SV_DESCRIPTION: Provides basic emergency health care services to people living in the Bella Coola region. Services are prioritized based on the severity of a patient's condition upon arrival.

Provides emergency health care and trauma services to residents of the North Shore, Powell River, Sechelt, Sea to Sky and the Bella Bella/Bella Coola. Services are prioritized based on the severity of a patient's condition upon arrival.

Provides emergency health care to residents of Vancouver. Services are prioritized based on the severity of a patient's condition upon arrival. In addition to emergency, orthopedic, and trauma care, select Providence emergency care sites offer specialized services. St. Paul's Hospital Emergency Care specializes in complex and multiple diagnosis, surgery, internal medicine, specialty medicine including neurology and stroke management, gastroenterology, respiratory, renal, obstetrical, urological, ophthalmological, head and neck, plastic surgery, mental health and cardiovascular care. Although there are no pediatric admissions, both St. Paul's Hospital and Mount St. Joseph's Hospital emergency staff have expertise to treat pediatric outpatient problems. Mount St. Joseph's Hospital sees patients with medical, surgical, and orthopedic problems. Children are seen at this site although there are no hospital admissions for pediatric aged patients.

Provides full range of basic and highly specialized emergency health care and trauma services to all of British Columbia. Provincial referral centre for quaternary emergency services including: spinal, neurosurgery, severe trauma, and severe burns. Houses the provincial burns centre. Services are prioritized based on the severity of a patient's condition upon arrival.

Provides emergency medical care for children 0 - 17 years of age. Staff includes: emergency physicians, pediatric-trained emergency nurses and psychiatric nurses, a clinical nurse educator, and child life specialists. Offers a family centered approach, with child-friendly space separate from the adult emergency department. Separate public entrance available with a walk-in and triage zone. Private treatment rooms as well as a designated area for pediatric mental health patients are available. Large treatment rooms will accommodate more family members with separate walls and glass doors to facilitate patient privacy. Located on the first floor of the critical care tower.
LANGUAGE: Full service interpreters available for most languages.
